main event: Three witnesses observed an unusually bright, pulsating light that changed from red to a greyish color over Tulsa, Oklahoma on September 1, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright, star-like object in motion, exhibiting fluctuations likely due to meteorological conditions.
The sighting was determined to be the planet Venus traveling in an easterly direction.
A subsequent letter from the USAF stated the sighting was likely caused by the re-entry of the ESSA 1 satellite on September 1, 1966.
Another witness, a cadet, reported seeing a large, rapidly moving object that seemed to come straight down from the sky and then disappeared.
The cadet was unable to take a photograph due to the short duration of the sighting.
sighted object: Bright, pulsating light; large, rapidly moving object
photographs: No photographs, only a hand-drawn sketch
